description:
About Re:Build Manufacturing

Re:Build Manufacturing is a family of industrial businesses combining cutting-edge enabling technologies, operational superiority, and strategic M&A to build America’s next generation industrial company. Re:Build leverages a deep expertise in operations management and technology to supercharge performance of its subsidiaries by implementing core technologies across industrial platforms in diversified growth markets. Our goal is to help revitalize the U.S. manufacturing base over the coming decades, creating substantial opportunities for our employees and the communities where we operate.

We leverage deep professional expertise and a candid, principled operating culture to drive differentiated outcomes for our customers, our employees, our communities, and our investors. Ours is a fast-paced environment where individuals can stretch and be challenged with a wide variety of opportunities and projects. We empower and support our employees to pursue their fullest potential and provide meaningful avenues for personal and professional growth.

Who we are looking for:

The Director of Business Development, Advanced Thermoplastics role will be responsible for driving and owning revenue growth for Oribi Composites by managing strategic accounts, identifying, and delivering on new opportunities, and positioning the Oribi Composites advanced thermoplastic technology in current or emerging markets for ongoing growth. While this role will support and collaborate across the other Re:Build Manufacturing sites, the role will be heavily focused on the development and growth of Oribi’s sales and pipeline activities.

What you will get to do:
• Enhancing and expanding current customer relationships to drive additional revenue growth.
• Identifying new applications and customers for Oribi’s technology and leading the selling and business development activities to drive revenue growth.
• Working with the technical and operational teams at Oribi to win, and execute on, new opportunities to build additional revenue streams for the business and to drive the business to meet its growth objectives.
• Engage across the other Re:Build Manufacturing sites to ensure that any multi-site program requirements, timelines, and milestones for success are clearly understood and resourced.
• Educate customers and target market segments on Oribi’s technology. Own, and identify, growth opportunities for Oribi to expand beyond its current niche into larger, higher volume and more profitable applications. Maintain a current and accurate customer level forecast for the business.
• Provide significant contributions to develop a best-in-class customer service organization and a top-notch customer experience.
• Complete vital administrative responsibilities such as maintaining a current CRM pipeline, timely submission of monthly reports, and other tasks as required.
• Participate in relevant industry trade associations, consortium's, and events.
• Support a heavy tradeshow and travel schedule to drive new customer engagements and revenue growth.
• Identify and route growth opportunities for other Re:Build Mfg. businesses.

What you bring to the team:
• Significant experience in selling and growing business for advanced materials and/or component manufacturing in the industrial, sporting goods, military, or aerospace industries.
• Proven business development track record in an engineering intensive, highly technical industry.
• Comfortable with developing content and presenting to internal and external Executive Leadership and to technical audiences in the composite industry.
• Ability to manage complex, multi-site and multi-functional, customer relationships along with developing strong Re:Build Manufacturing to customer and peer to peer engagements.
• Able to evaluate a basic financial model and develop proactive strategic recommendations to improve margins and increase profit.
• A strong desire to demonstrate both individual and team success for the business.
• Personal curiosity to operate in a learning environment and develop an understanding of cross-site Re:Build Manufacturing capabilities to strengthen our relationships and value at customers.
• Proximity to Denver, CO preferred.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
• 4 year Bachelor's degree (Engineering discipline preferred)
• 10+ years of business development, or relevant industry, experience
• Experience selling advanced composites or thermoplastic solutions into the industrial, sporting goods, aerospace, automotive, and/or energy industries.
• Executive level presentation skills

LANGUAGE SKILLS:
• Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general financial documents, professional journals, technical procedures, or government regulations.
• Ability to write reports and business correspondence.
• Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, supervisors, and employees.
• Must be able to read, speak, write, and understand Basic English.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:
• Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, and percentages.
• Ability to apply concepts such as fractions and percentages to practical situations.
• Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra.
• Work closely with the continued development of basic and semi-complex cost models to further enhance our ability to estimate and develop appropriate pricing strategies.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES:
• The position requires a strong working understanding of computers and various spreadsheet and word processing software packages.
• A strong ability to communicate effectively is required.
• Must be able to travel 40-70% of the time including some weekends.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:
• The individual must be willing to work in a very dynamic and fast paced environment with a strong ability to independently prioritize time, travel, and customer efforts.
• This will be a hybrid role, working remotely but also be willing to frequently engage with the Re:Build Manufacturing sites and be present, and therefore must have the discipline to work independently but also in a collaborative team environment.

Compensation:
• The salary range for is from $130,000 to $170,000 and will also include an annual performance bonus and participation in the Long Term Incentive Program referenced below.

The BIG payoff

We are a company who is going to make a difference in the industries and the communities in which we choose to operate.

Every employee of Re:Build will share ownership in the company and will share in the financial rewards of the success we achieve together, at all levels of the company!

We want to work with people that reflect the communities in which we operate

Re:Build Manufacturing is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, marital status, parental status, cultural background, organizational level, work styles, tenure, and life experiences. Or for any other reason.

Re:Build is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations.ta@ReBuildmanufacturing.com or you may call us at 617.909.6275.
